title: Field Application Strategy Development Through Comparative Analysis of HRD Master’s Programs

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge in HRD (Human Resource Development) and organizational management experience
context.additional_context: Focus on deriving practical insights through peer experience-sharing, establishing enterprise-applicable strategies based on analysis of HRD program characteristics across institutions.

learning_goals: Learners can compare institutional characteristics (College of Education vs. Business School) of U.S. HRD master’s programs and explain key differences.
Learners can analyze differences in HRD program curricula to evaluate learner competencies and job relevance.
Based on analysis results, learners can propose three practical strategies applicable to improving HRD strategies in their organization.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
